formattedAddress: 30 Lincoln Center Plaza, New York, NY 10023, USA
adrFormatAddress: 30 Lincoln Center Plaza, New York, NY 10023, USA

editorialSummary.text: Pre-curtain & intermission service with fine dining meals & a full bar under the chandelier.

originalText.text: I ordered the carpaccio and the beef tenderloin. Both were delicious. My wife ordered the Osso Bucco and was amazing. Great experience overall having a lovely dinner along side with a great Opera show.

text.text: I ordered the carpaccio and the beef tenderloin. Both were delicious. My wife ordered the Osso Bucco and was amazing. Great experience overall having a lovely dinner along side with a great Opera show.

originalText.text: From start to finish this was an amazing experience.  When James greeted us upon arrival we felt welcomed. Juan Pablo sat us and got us situated. Our waitress Julhi was so accommodating and warm.   The food was spectacular.  We enjoyed having our dessert at intermission. The opera was just fabulous.  We can't wait to go back.  There is no better place to have dinner before the show.

text.text: From start to finish this was an amazing experience.  When James greeted us upon arrival we felt welcomed. Juan Pablo sat us and got us situated. Our waitress Julhi was so accommodating and warm.   The food was spectacular.  We enjoyed having our dessert at intermission. The opera was just fabulous.  We can't wait to go back.  There is no better place to have dinner before the show.

originalText.text:
#Patina’s #GrandTier Restaurant’s “DIFFERENTIATOR”: A #Waitstaff of 15-20-25 years experience in #Guest #Indulgences led by their Mgr. ARBY: “TABLE SIDE” Presentations. #Chef Florian introduced an Inventive themed Fall Menu: #Roasted Sunchoke Soup ala Black Truffles, Charred Octopus, Bison Carpaccio, Venison Oslo Buico, Skate Wing Mariniere, Lobster Thermidor. Pumpkin crème brûlée, poached pear frozen soufflé, opera cake-choc. Ganache
Thanks: Talia, Arby, Duke, Denzel, Omar

originalText.text:
What an extraordinary meal, before an extraordinary show, the Magic Flute. The bison, carpaccio, aesthetically, pleasing, and flavorly balanced. The beef tenderloin, I ordered black and blue, a.k.a. Pittsburgh, was perfect. I ordered the bananas fosters, lavender crème brûlée, and fruit and berries, all three were delicious. I am classically trained in French service techniques, and I did receive a few backhands, and some solids delivered with the right, but I hold myself at a higher standard than most servers. Definitely will return.

Instagram: @holycityhost

originalText.text: Go pre-curtain for a more leisurely, early dinner. However, they’ll make a one course meal - or a chic dessert situation - work beautifully during an intermission. Excellent, attentive, and speedy service. It’s expensive, but you’re dining within one of the most spectacular cultural destinations in the world. Get the fillet mignon - by far the best entree. The salmon is also lovely. For dessert, the mixed berries are a big enough portion for two to share.
